com.xing.api

Interface CallSpec<RT,ET>

  • Type Parameters:
    RT - Successful response body type.
    ET - Error response body type.
    All Superinterfaces:
    java.lang.Cloneable

    public interface CallSpec<RT,ET>
extends java.lang.Cloneable
    An invocation of a resource method that sends a request to the XING API and returns a response. Each call yields its own HTTP request and response pair. Use clone() to make multiple calls with the same parameters to the same resource call; this may be used to implement polling or to retry a failed call.

    Calls may be executed synchronously with execute(), asynchronously with enqueue(com.xing.api.Callback<RT, ET>), or as asynchronous observable streams with stream(), singleStream(), completableStream() or rawStream() (Note: that a dependency to RxJava is required). In either case the call can be canceled at any time with cancel(). A call that is busy writing its request or reading its response may receive a IOException; this is working as designed.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static class  CallSpec.Builder<RT,ET>
      Serves two purposes, to build the CallSpec and the underlying Request.

    • Method Detail

      • execute

        Response<RT,ET> execute()
                 throws java.io.IOException
        Synchronously executes the request and returns it's response.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If a problem occurred while talking to the server.
        java.lang.RuntimeException - If an unexpected error occurred during execution or while parsing response.

      • enqueue

        void enqueue(Callback<RT,ET> callback)
        Asynchronously send the request and notify callback of its response or if an error occurred talking to the server, creating the request, or processing the response.

        This method is null-safe, which means that there will be no failure or error propagated if callback methods will throw an error.

        Note that the callback will be dropped after the call execution.

      • rawStream

        <any> rawStream()
        Executes the underlying call as an observable. The observable will try to return an Response object from which the http result may be obtained.

      • stream

        <any> stream()
        Executes the underlying call as an observable. This method will try to populate the success response object of a Response. In case of an error an HttpException will be thrown. For a more richer and controllable api consider calling rawStream().

      • singleStream

        <any> singleStream()
        Same as stream() but returning a Single.

      • completableStream

        @Experimental
Completable completableStream()
        Same as stream() but returning a Completable.

      • isExecuted

        boolean isExecuted()
        Returns true if this call has been either executed or enqueued. It is an error to execute or enqueue a call more than once.

      • isCanceled

        boolean isCanceled()
        True if cancel() was called.

      • cancel

        void cancel()
        Cancel this call. An attempt will be made to cancel in-flight calls, and if the call has not yet been executed it never will be.

      • header

        CallSpec<RT,ET> header(java.lang.String name,
                       java.lang.String value)
        Sets the provided header to the underlying request.

      • queryParam

        CallSpec<RT,ET> queryParam(java.lang.String name,
                           java.lang.Object value)
        Appends a query parameter to the query string of the underlying request's url.

      • queryParam

        CallSpec<RT,ET> queryParam(java.lang.String name,
                           java.lang.String value)
        Appends a query parameter to the query string of the underlying request's url.

      • queryParam

        CallSpec<RT,ET> queryParam(java.lang.String name,
                           java.lang.String... values)
        Appends a query parameter as a csv list to the query string of the underlying request's url.

      • queryParam

        CallSpec<RT,ET> queryParam(java.lang.String name,
                           java.util.List<java.lang.String> values)
        Appends a query parameter as a csv list to the query string of the underlying request's url.

      • formField

        CallSpec<RT,ET> formField(java.lang.String name,
                          java.lang.String value,
                          boolean encode)
        Adds a form field to the underlying request's form body. The form field value will be utf-8 encoded if encode is true

        This will throw an NullPointerException if the form body support was not specified during spec creation.

      • formField

        CallSpec<RT,ET> formField(java.lang.String name,
                          java.lang.String value)
        Adds a form field to the underlying request's form body.

        This will throw an NullPointerException if the form body support was not specified during spec creation.

      • formField

        CallSpec<RT,ET> formField(java.lang.String name,
                          java.lang.Object value)
        Adds a form field to the underlying request's form body.

        This will throw an NullPointerException if the form body support was not specified during spec creation.

      • formField

        CallSpec<RT,ET> formField(java.lang.String name,
                          java.lang.String... values)
        Adds a form field as a csv list to the underlying request's form body.

        This will throw an NullPointerException if the form body support was not specified during spec creation.

      • formField

        This will throw an NullPointerException if the form body support was not specified during spec creation.
